snippet: A long, cold and snowy winter has brought a flurry of extra expenses for car repairs, higher heating bills and replacement of lost mittens, expenses that have piled up along with the snow.
abstract: Copious snow and ice in much of New York City and the region this winter has exacted a financial price that is only now becoming clear; residents paid far more in utilities, incidentals and lost income than in previous years, as municipalities racked up high bills clearing snow and ice, while missing out on revenue.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: A long, cold and snowy winter has brought a flurry of extra expenses for car repairs, higher heating bills and replacement of lost mittens, expenses that have piled up along with the snow.

headline.main: Costs Have Piled Up Along With the Snow of a Difficult Winter
headline.print_headline: Jack Frost Nips at the Wallet, and the Nerves
